Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk evolution
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: evolution bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: Evolution is a GNOME application that provides integrated email, calendar, contact management and communications functionality. The components which make up Evolution are tightly integrated with one another and act as a seamless personal information-management (PIM) tool. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, an automatic "mark message as seen" process could fail in certain cases, which caused that a message was not automatically marked after reading. With this update, conditions for the "mark message as seen" process have been corrected, and read messages are now marked as intended. (BZ#1097268) Prior to this update, some memory was not freed properly by the Evolution code. This update ensures that Evolution code frees all the allocated memory properly, and memory leaks thus no longer occur. (BZ#1097269) When trying to open a message which did not belong to the current view filter, a separate message window closed immediately, was opened empty, or a selected message was not shown. This update makes sure that a selected message always belongs to the view filter, thus fixing the bug. Filtered messages are now successfully opened in a separate window. (BZ#1097270) Previously, certain user interactions could cause the evolution processes to become unresponsive and consume a high percentage of CPU. A workaround to avoid this state has been applied, and a busy loop is no longer triggered in this case. (BZ#1097271) Users of evolution are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. All running instances of Evolution must be restarted for this update to take effect. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
